author: yperbasis
content: Is it correct that after the merge validators will only be rewarded with transaction fees? EIP-3675 removes block rewards. It says "The new PoS consensus becomes both responsible for sealing blocks and for issuing block rewards once this specification enters into effect.", but I don't see a mechanism how the consensus layer notifies the execution layer about any rewards besides transaction fees.

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: The validator rewards are calculated on the consensus layer, so they will be payed there. And with the cleanup fork there will be a away to notify the execution layer of the exits (which will create money on the el)

author: yperbasis
content: Ok, so before the cleanup fork validator rewards will be unclaimable?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: yes just as they are right now (beacon chain validators are already accumulating rewards)

author: m.kalinin
content: Before the withdrawals functionality is implemented validator rewards paid for their consensus duties (attesting to and proposing a block) are unclaimable. Transaction fees will be paid via the coinbase mechanism on EL as it is done today.

author: m.kalinin
content: So, it means that every party responsible for a payload building whether it's a validator itself or a 3rd party block builder will get transaction fees and MEV to its coinbase. Validators may provide their EL address in the `feeRecipient` parameter passed in `PayloadAttributes` to be included as a coinbase of EL block.

author: ralexstokes
content: these should come in this PR from <@!415109946682769408>  https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/2706

author: joshuaisbuilding
content: Post-merge are you able to only run an execution layer node to get data instead of using something like Infura? (and you don't want to stake). Or would you need to run a consensus layer client too?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: No, you need to run both a consensus layer and an execution node. But you don't need to stake.

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: You need to have a node that follows the beacon chain (without having to propose blocks)

author: timbeiko
content: I'm mildly against using "clean up" fork: it makes it sound like it will be somehow different. Realistically, withdrawals for the validators' stakes and earned rewards will need to be implemented in the fork after the merge (Shanghai?) and will likely come alongside other regular EIPs and whatnot.
